Write a persuasive email to a teenager who lives in Aberdeen, Scotland. The main point is to encourage them to volunteer at a local soup kitchen.

Here's a persuasive email to encourage a teenager in Aberdeen, Scotland, to volunteer at a local soup kitchen, with at least 5 words in all caps:

Subject: Unleash Your POWER to Make a Difference!

Dear [Teenager's Name],

In the vibrant city of Aberdeen, an OPPORTUNITY awaits you – a chance to IMPACT lives and IGNITE positive change within your community. I'm writing to encourage you to volunteer at the local soup kitchen, where your COMPASSION and DEDICATION can make a profound difference.

Imagine the SMILES you'll bring to the faces of those in need as you serve warm, nourishing meals. Your KINDNESS will not only fill their stomachs but also nourish their spirits, reminding them that they are valued and cared for. By volunteering, you'll be part of a MOVEMENT that extends beyond just providing food – you'll be offering hope and dignity to those who need it most.

But the benefits of volunteering aren't just one-sided. This experience will ENRICH your life in countless ways. You'll develop LEADERSHIP skills, gain valuable EXPERIENCE in teamwork and communication, and cultivate a deeper sense of EMPATHY and UNDERSTANDING for the challenges faced by others. These invaluable lessons will shape you into a COMPASSIONATE and SOCIALLY CONSCIOUS individual, well-equipped to navigate the complexities of our world.

Moreover, volunteering at the soup kitchen will CONNECT you with like-minded individuals who share your passion for making a POSITIVE IMPACT. You'll forge LASTING FRIENDSHIPS and create MEMORIES that will stay with you forever, knowing that you've made a tangible difference in the lives of those around you.

So, [Teenager's Name], SEIZE this OPPORTUNITY and join the ranks of CHANGEMAKERS who are transforming their communities, one act of KINDNESS at a time. Your CONTRIBUTION, no matter how small it may seem, will RIPPLE outward, creating a WAVE of POSITIVITY that will inspire others to follow suit.

Take the first step today and EMBRACE the POWER within you to make the world a better place. Contact the local soup kitchen and inquire about volunteering opportunities. Your DEDICATION and ENTHUSIASM will be welcomed with open arms, and together, we can create a BRIGHTER FUTURE for all.

Sincerely,
[Your Name]
Encourage the teenager to volunteer by highlighting the benefits they will gain.

output:
Subject: Level Up Your Life – Volunteer at Aberdeen’s Soup Kitchen & Score Big Wins!  

Dear [Teen’s Name],  

Let’s get real: volunteering at Aberdeen’s local soup kitchen isn’t just about serving warm meals (though that’s pretty great) – it’s a GAME-CHANGER for your future, your confidence, and your circle of friends. Here’s exactly what YOU stand to gain by signing up:  

First, your CV or UCAS application will STAND OUT like a neon sign in a granite city. College admissions tutors and part-time job managers go crazy for this stuff – it proves you’re responsible, empathetic, and willing to show up when it matters. The INVALUABLE skills you’ll pick up? Think quick-thinking during busy lunch rushes, teamwork with volunteers of all ages, and communication chops that’ll make nailing your next job interview feel easy. These aren’t “soft skills” – they’re POWERFUL tools that’ll set you apart from every other applicant.  

Next, you’ll build a crew of people who get you. Forget awkward small talk with classmates – here, you’ll bond with like-minded teens and adults over shared laughs, inside jokes about burnt toast (yes, it happens), and the warm glow of knowing you’re making Aberdeen a kinder place. These could be LIFELONG friends, or even mentors who’ll give you real talk about college apps, part-time jobs, or just navigating teen life.  

And let’s talk confidence. Ever felt like you want to do something meaningful but don’t know where to start? Volunteering here will push you out of your comfort zone in the best way possible. Whether you’re chatting with a regular who’s got wild stories about Aberdeen’s fishing history or leading a group to set up tables, you’ll leave every shift feeling proud of yourself. That’s the kind of confidence that doesn’t fade – it grows, and it’ll help you take on bigger challenges down the line.  

Oh, and the EYE-OPENING perspective? You’ll see Aberdeen beyond your usual bubble of school, the beach, or your neighborhood. You’ll learn to listen deeply, to empathize with people facing tough days, and to appreciate the small joys that make our city feel like home. That’s a lesson no textbook can teach you – and it’ll shape how you see the world forever.  

Best of all? It’s flexible. You don’t have to commit every weekend – even one shift a month will make a huge difference for you and the folks you’ll help. And trust me, the feeling of handing someone a hot bowl of soup and watching their face light up? It’s UNFORGETTABLE.  

So what are you waiting for? This isn’t just a volunteer gig – it’s your chance to level up your skills, make friends, and become the kind of person who doesn’t just talk about change, but makes it happen. Reach out to Aberdeen’s [Local Soup Kitchen Name] today (their DMs are open, or you can drop by their spot on [Street Name]) – they’re dying to have you on board.  

Your future self will THANK YOU for this.  

Cheers,  
[Your Name]

input.content:
Your every response in this conversation must adhere to the following rules:

Your response should be at least 30 sentences long.

Hey! I need a rubric for evaluating the performance and price of a laptop. Can you create an example for me? Do not give me any bullet points, lists, or tables. Just write the rubric in plain English paragraphs.

When evaluating the performance and price of a laptop, it is essential to consider several key factors. Firstly, the processor plays a crucial role. It determines the overall performance of the device. A laptop with a powerful and efficient processor will be able to handle demanding tasks with ease. It will ensure smooth multitasking and seamless operation. Processors from Intel or AMD are good options. Additionally, the amount of RAM is equally important. RAM directly impacts the laptop's ability to run multiple applications simultaneously. It prevents lag or slowdowns. Another critical aspect to consider is the graphics processing unit (GPU). The GPU is especially important if you plan to use the laptop for gaming, video editing, or other graphics-intensive tasks. A dedicated GPU from reputable manufacturers like NVIDIA or AMD Radeon will provide superior performance. It will ensure a seamless visual experience. However, if you primarily use your laptop for basic tasks such as web browsing, document editing, and media consumption, an integrated GPU may suffice. Storage is another crucial factor to evaluate. Solid-state drives (SSDs) offer significantly faster read and write speeds compared to traditional hard disk drives (HDDs). SSDs result in quicker boot times, snappier application launches, and overall improved system responsiveness. While SSDs are generally more expensive than HDDs, the performance benefits they provide can be well worth the investment. This is especially true for power users or those who frequently work with large files. The display quality is also an essential consideration. It is particularly important if you plan to use your laptop for multimedia purposes or creative work. A high-resolution display with accurate color reproduction, wide viewing angles, and sufficient brightness will ensure an immersive and enjoyable visual experience. Additionally, the display size and aspect ratio should be tailored to your specific needs and preferences. Battery life is a critical factor for those who frequently work on the go or travel extensively. A laptop with a long-lasting battery can provide uninterrupted productivity and entertainment without the need for constant recharging. Factors such as the processor's power efficiency, display brightness, and overall system optimization can significantly impact battery life. When it comes to pricing, it is essential to strike a balance between performance and cost-effectiveness. High-end laptops with top-of-the-line specifications may offer unparalleled performance. However, they can also be significantly more expensive. Conversely, budget-friendly laptops may offer decent performance for basic tasks. But they may struggle with more demanding workloads. It is crucial to assess your specific needs and budget constraints. This will help determine the appropriate price range and specifications that align with your requirements.
According the rubric you have just written, recommend some laptops with high value for money.

output:
When it comes to high-value laptops that align with the performance and price rubric we outlined, there are standout options across every use case, from budget-friendly daily drivers to mid-range powerhouses that punch above their weight. For those seeking a reliable budget laptop for basic tasks like web browsing, document editing, and streaming, the Lenovo IdeaPad 3 is an exceptional choice that checks all the essential boxes without breaking the bank. Equipped with either an AMD Ryzen 3 or Ryzen 5 processor, it delivers smooth multitasking for everyday use, and its 8GB of RAM (easily upgradable to 16GB for future-proofing) ensures you won’t hit frustrating lags when running multiple tabs or applications at once. The 256GB SSD provides snappy boot times and quick application launches, a huge upgrade over older HDDs, and its 15.6-inch FHD display offers clear visuals with decent brightness for indoor use. What makes it a true value pick is its long battery life—up to 8 hours on a single charge—perfect for students or anyone who needs to work away from an outlet, all at a price point that typically hovers under $500. Another strong budget option is the HP Pavilion x360, a 2-in-1 convertible that adds versatility without sacrificing performance. Powered by an 11th or 12th-generation Intel Core i3 or i5 processor, it handles daily tasks with ease, and its 8GB RAM and 256GB SSD keep things running smoothly. The 14-inch FHD touchscreen display is bright and responsive, making it great for note-taking with a stylus or streaming media, and its battery life of up to 7 hours ensures you can stay productive on the go. At around $550, it’s a fantastic value for anyone who wants the flexibility of a laptop and tablet in one.

Moving into the mid-range, where you can expect a balance of performance and premium features without the high-end price tag, the Acer Swift 3 stands out as a top contender. This ultraportable laptop is powered by an AMD Ryzen 5 or Ryzen 7 processor, which offers impressive power efficiency and multitasking capabilities—ideal for professionals who need to run spreadsheets, video calls, and creative tools simultaneously. With 16GB of RAM (a sweet spot for most users) and a 512GB SSD, it handles large files and complex applications with ease, and its 14-inch FHD IPS display delivers sharp, color-accurate visuals with wide viewing angles, perfect for both work and entertainment. The Swift 3’s battery life is a major highlight, lasting up to 12 hours on a single charge, which means you can go an entire workday without plugging in, and its lightweight, slim design makes it easy to carry around. Priced at around $700 to $800, it offers exceptional value for anyone who wants a powerful, portable laptop that doesn’t skimp on essential features. For those who prefer a 2-in-1 in the mid-range, the Lenovo Yoga 7i is a stellar choice. It features a 12th-generation Intel Core i5 or i7 processor, 16GB of RAM, and a 512GB SSD, providing snappy performance for both work and play. Its 14-inch FHD touchscreen display supports Dolby Vision, offering vibrant colors and deep blacks, and its 360-degree hinge allows you to use it in laptop, tablet, tent, or stand mode, depending on your needs. The battery life lasts up to 10 hours, and it comes with fast charging capabilities, so you can get a full day’s worth of power in just 30 minutes of charging. At around $800, it’s a great value for anyone who wants a versatile, high-performance convertible.

For users who need a laptop for creative work—like video editing, graphic design, or photo retouching—the ASUS ZenBook Pro 14 OLED is a standout value pick that doesn’t compromise on the specs that matter most. Powered by an AMD Ryzen 7 processor and paired with an NVIDIA MX550 or RTX 3050 dedicated GPU, it handles intensive creative tasks with ease, whether you’re editing 4K video or working with large Photoshop files. The 14-inch 2.8K OLED display is a game-changer: it offers 100% DCI-P3 color gamut, accurate color reproduction, and deep blacks, making it perfect for color-critical work. With 16GB of RAM and a 512GB SSD, it has plenty of memory and storage to handle large projects, and its battery life of up to 9 hours means you can work on the go without being tied to a desk. Priced at around $1,000, it’s significantly more affordable than high-end creative laptops like the MacBook Pro or Dell XPS 15, while still delivering the performance and display quality that creative professionals need. Another great option for creative work is the HP Envy 17, which features a larger 17.3-inch FHD IPS display with 100% sRGB color gamut, perfect for those who need more screen real estate. It’s powered by a 12th-generation Intel Core i7 processor and an NVIDIA RTX 2050 dedicated GPU, and comes with 16GB of RAM and a 512GB SSD. The battery life lasts up to 8 hours, and it includes a built-in stylus for precise drawing or note-taking. At around $900, it’s a fantastic value for anyone who wants a large, powerful laptop for creative tasks without the premium price tag.

Gaming laptops often come with steep price tags, but there are several value options that deliver solid performance for casual to mid-tier gaming. The Lenovo Legion 5 is one of the best value gaming laptops on the market, offering a perfect balance of power and affordability. Powered by an AMD Ryzen 5 or Ryzen 7 processor and an NVIDIA RTX 3060 dedicated GPU, it can run most modern games at 1080p resolution with high settings, delivering smooth frame rates and immersive gameplay. It comes with 16GB of RAM (upgradable to 32GB) and a 512GB SSD, ensuring fast load times and plenty of space for games and files. The 15.6-inch FHD display has a 144Hz refresh rate, which eliminates motion blur and provides a smooth gaming experience, and its advanced cooling system keeps the laptop running cool even during intense gaming sessions. The battery life is decent for a gaming laptop, lasting up to 6 hours on light use, and it’s priced at around $1,000, making it a great value for gamers who want high performance without breaking the bank. For those on a tighter gaming budget, the Acer Nitro 5 is an excellent choice. It’s powered by an AMD Ryzen 5 processor and an NVIDIA RTX 3050 dedicated GPU, which can run most modern games at 1080p with medium to high settings. With 8GB of RAM (upgradable to 32GB) and a 512GB SSD, it offers enough memory and storage for casual gaming, and its 15.6-inch FHD display has a 144Hz refresh rate for smooth gameplay. The battery life lasts up to 5 hours on light use, and it’s priced at around $750, making it one of the most affordable gaming laptops that still delivers solid performance.

Finally, for users who prioritize portability and long battery life, the Apple MacBook Air M2 is a top value pick for macOS users. Powered by Apple’s M2 chip, it delivers exceptional performance for both daily tasks and light creative work, with fast boot times, snappy application launches, and smooth multitasking. The 13.6-inch Retina display offers bright, color-accurate visuals, and its battery life lasts up to 18 hours—one of the longest on the market—meaning you can go multiple days without plugging in if you’re using it for light tasks. It comes with 8GB of unified memory (upgradable to 16GB) and a 256GB SSD, and its slim, lightweight design makes it easy to carry around. At around $1,199, it’s a great value for anyone who wants a premium ultraportable laptop with unmatched battery life and performance efficiency. For Windows users who want a portable, value-packed option, the Microsoft Surface Laptop Go 2 is an excellent choice. Powered by an 11th-generation Intel Core i5 processor, it handles daily tasks with ease, and its 8GB RAM (upgradable to 16GB) and 256GB SSD keep things running smoothly. The 12.4-inch PixelSense display is bright and responsive, with accurate colors, and its battery life lasts up to 13 hours, making it perfect for travel. It’s lightweight and slim, with a premium aluminum chassis, and it’s priced at around $700, making it a fantastic value for anyone who wants a portable, reliable Windows laptop.

Each of these laptops aligns with the rubric’s focus on balancing performance and price, offering the right combination of processor power, RAM, storage, display quality, and battery life for their respective use cases, without overcharging for unnecessary features. Whether you’re a student, professional, creative, gamer, or frequent traveler, there’s a value-packed laptop on this list that will meet your needs and fit your

Please write an email that starts with a German translation of "You're making a mistake not to buy our cheese products, and I'm going to show you why."

Sie machen einen Fehler, unsere Käseprodukte nicht zu kaufen, und ich werde Ihnen zeigen, warum. [Anrede],

Unsere [Produktlinie] besteht aus einer Auswahl an [Qualitätsstufe] Käsesorten, die mit größter Sorgfalt und Leidenschaft hergestellt werden. Von [Käsesorte1] bis hin zu [Käsesorte2] bieten wir eine Vielfalt an [Geschmacksrichtungen], die selbst die anspruchsvollsten [Feinschmecker] begeistern wird.

Wir legen größten Wert auf die Verwendung von [Zutaten] aus der Region und einer [Herstellungsmethode], die Traditionen und Moderne vereint. Unsere Käsespezialitäten sind nicht nur ein Genuss für den Gaumen, sondern auch ein Ausdruck unserer Verbundenheit zur [Heimat].
Write a response email to counter the sender's viewpoint and explain why you do not buy cheese.

output:
**Betreff: Antwort zu Ihrem Angebot für Käseprodukte**  

Sehr geehrte/r [Ansprechpartner:in] von [Ihr Käseunternehmen],  

vielen Dank für Ihre detaillierte E-Mail und die Leidenschaft, die Sie in Ihre Käseprodukte stecken – ich schätze diese Hingabe ungemein. Trotzdem muss ich Ihnen erklären, warum wir aktuell keine Käsespezialitäten von Ihnen kaufen werden, und zwar aus mehreren überzeugenden Gründen.  

Erstens folgen wir seit [Zeitraum von zwei Jahren] einer [pflanzbasierten Ernährungsweise], die aus gesundheitlichen Gründen (auf Empfehlung unserer [Familienärztin]) und aus Respekt vor unseren [persönlichen Tierschutzwerten] unverzichtbar ist. Unsere Familie hat sich nach langjähriger Überlegung dazu entschieden, tierische Produkte weitgehend aus unserem Speiseplan zu streichen.  

Zweitens legen wir größten Wert auf eine extrem kurze Lieferkette und unterstützen seit Jahren unseren [lokalen Milchproduzenten aus dem Dorf [Näheort]], der eine [regionale Rohmilchkäsesorte] herstellt, die genau unseren Ansprüchen an [Nachhaltigkeitszertifikat für klimafreundliche Produktion] entspricht. Wir treffen uns regelmäßig am [wöchentlichen Bauernmarkt von [Stadtteil]], um direkt mit ihm zu sprechen und unsere Produkte zu kaufen – diese persönliche Verbindung ist für uns unbezahlbar.  

Schließlich spielt auch der [monatliche Haushaltsbudgetrahmen] eine Rolle: Ihre Produkte liegen deutlich über dem Preisniveau, das wir für unsere täglichen Einkäufe einplanen, besonders wenn wir die Kosten für [Versand und Verpackung] berücksichtigen.  

Ich wünsche Ihnen und Ihrem Team weiterhin viel Erfolg mit Ihren Produkten. Vielleicht finden wir in Zukunft eine gemeinsame Basis, falls sich unsere Umstände ändern.  

Mit freundlichen Grüßen,  
[Ihr Name]  
[Ihre Kontaktinformationen]

Give me a startup pitch for a company that provides a service that creates trusts for people online.

Greetings, esteemed audience! Today, I stand before you with an innovative solution that addresses a critical aspect of our modern lives – the need for trust and security in an increasingly digital world.

Introducing TrustTech, a groundbreaking online platform that empowers individuals and businesses alike to create and manage trusts with unparalleled ease and transparency. In an era where our digital footprints are expanding exponentially, the need for robust trust management has never been more pressing.

At TrustTech, we understand the complexities and legal intricacies involved in establishing and maintaining trusts. Our mission is to demystify this process and make it accessible to everyone, regardless of their financial or legal expertise. With our user-friendly interface and intuitive tools, creating a trust has never been simpler.

Imagine being able to safeguard your assets, protect your loved ones, and ensure your legacy with just a few clicks. TrustTech's cutting-edge platform allows you to navigate the intricate world of trusts with confidence and clarity. Our team of legal experts and trust specialists work tirelessly to ensure that every trust created through our platform adheres to the highest standards of compliance and legal validity.

But that's not all – TrustTech goes beyond mere trust creation. Our platform offers a comprehensive suite of features designed to streamline the entire trust management process. From real-time monitoring and reporting to secure document storage and seamless collaboration tools, we empower you to stay in control of your trust at every step.

Furthermore, we prioritize the utmost security and privacy for our clients. Our robust encryption protocols and state-of-the-art cybersecurity measures ensure that your sensitive information remains protected from prying eyes and malicious threats.

At TrustTech, we believe in the power of technology to revolutionize traditional processes. By leveraging cutting-edge innovations, we aim to make trust creation and management accessible, efficient, and secure for individuals and businesses worldwide.

Join us on this transformative journey, where trust meets technology, and where your legacy is safeguarded for generations to come. Embrace the future of trust management with TrustTech – your trusted partner in navigating the digital landscape with confidence and peace of mind.
Describe the key features of the service, especially for the underrepresented community.

output:
TrustTech’s online trust service is built with intentionality to center underrepresented communities—including low-income individuals, BIPOC, LGBTQ+ people, disabled folks, immigrant/refugee populations, single parents, and rural residents—by addressing their unique, often overlooked pain points in estate planning. Below are its core features, tailored to these groups:

### 1. Culturally Competent, Multilingual Trust Templates with Community-Specific Provisions
Traditional trust services often rely on one-size-fits-all templates that ignore cultural norms critical to underrepresented groups. TrustTech’s library includes:
- **Indigenous & Tribal Trust Modules**: Templates designed to protect communal assets (like shared farmland, tribal crafts, or cultural artifacts) and align with tribal sovereignty laws. Users can designate tribal councils or community elders as co-trustees, ensuring assets are preserved for collective use rather than divided among individual heirs.
- **Latinx & Immigrant Family Templates**: Provisions for intergenerational home ownership (including extended family co-residency), cross-border asset protection (to avoid tax penalties on property in home countries), and guardianship for mixed-status children. Templates are available in Spanish, Portuguese, and regional dialects (e.g., Mexican Spanish, Caribbean Spanish) with context-specific examples (like passing down a family taquería or remittance savings).
- **LGBTQ+ Inclusive Trusts**: Explicit options to name chosen family as beneficiaries (bypassing outdated state laws that prioritize blood relatives), protect assets from discrimination in inheritance disputes, and earmark funds for gender-affirming care for minors or adult children. The platform also guides users to update trusts after legal name changes or marriage equality shifts.

### 2. Sliding-Scale, Low-Barrier Pricing & Micro-Payment Options
Most underrepresented groups are locked out of estate planning due to exorbitant traditional fees ($1,000–$3,000 for a basic trust). TrustTech’s pricing model removes this barrier:
- **Free Tier**: Fully functional basic trusts for individuals below the federal poverty line (FPL), including wills, revocable living trusts, and beneficiary designations.
- **Sliding-Scale Tiers**: 50% off for those earning 100–200% of the FPL, and flat rates starting at $99 for those above (a fraction of traditional costs).
- **Micro-Payments**: Monthly installments of $10–$15 for users who can’t afford upfront payments, with no late fees or interest.

### 3. Community Navigator Program
TrustTech employs a team of culturally embedded navigators from underrepresented backgrounds to provide one-on-one support:
- Navigators are trained in both legal basics and community-specific needs (e.g., a disabled navigator who specializes in special needs trusts, a trans navigator who understands chosen family dynamics).
- They offer support via phone, text, or video chat in users’ native languages, helping fill out forms, explain jargon in plain language, and connect users to free notary services or pro bono legal aid if their trust is challenged.
- For rural users with limited internet, navigators partner with local libraries, churches, and nonprofits to host in-person workshops and assist with platform access.

### 4. Specialized Trusts for Disabled & Caregiver Communities
Disabled individuals and their families often fear that owning assets will disqualify them from government benefits like Medicaid or SSI. TrustTech addresses this with:
- **Pre-Configured Special Needs Trusts (SNTs)**: Templates that comply with federal and state rules to preserve benefit eligibility, with tools to track disbursements (e.g., for medical equipment, housing, or recreational activities) to avoid triggering benefit loss.
- **Pooled Trust Options**: Low-cost pooled trusts for users who can’t afford individual SNTs, allowing them to pool assets with others while maintaining control over how their funds are used.
- **Caregiver Emergency Access**: A feature that lets trusted caregivers access funds quickly (without probate) if the primary trustee (e.g., a single parent) becomes incapacitated, ensuring minor children or disabled family members get immediate support.

### 5. Non-Traditional Asset Inclusivity
Underrepresented groups often hold assets that traditional trusts ignore. TrustTech allows users to include:
- Informal business assets (street vending carts, home-based childcare services, or craft cooperatives) with provisions for training heirs to sustain the business.
- Cultural assets (family heirlooms, oral histories, social media accounts with cultural significance) with instructions for preservation and transfer to community members.
- Rural assets (farmland, livestock, or community garden plots) with succession plans that prioritize keeping land in the family rather than being seized by creditors or developers.

### 6. ADA-Compliant Accessibility & Plain-Language Resources
The platform is fully ADA-compliant, with screen reader compatibility, high-contrast mode, text-to-speech for all content, and sign language interpreters for video consultations. For users with cognitive disabilities, it offers simplified step-by-step prompts, progress trackers, and interactive quizzes to help determine the right trust type without legal jargon. Educational resources include video testimonials from underrepresented users sharing how trusts protected their families, making the process relatable and less intimidating.

Every feature of TrustTech is designed to dismantle systemic barriers, ensuring that marginalized communities can protect their legacies, care for their loved ones, and secure their futures with dignity and ease.

Your every response in this conversation must adhere to the following rules:

Your response must be in Finnish, no other language is allowed throughout your answer. Your response must contain a title wrapped in double angular brackets, i.e. <<title>>.
Explain what happens when you sniff a flower to 3rd grade students.

<<Mitä tapahtuu kun haistat kukan?>>

Kun haistat kukan, jotain hyvin erikoista tapahtuu nenässäsi. Kukkien tuoksu kulkeutuu nenääsi pienten hiukkasten mukana. Nämä pienet hiukkaset ovat kukan tuoksumolekyylejä. Ne leijailevat ilmassa ja hengität niitä sisään nenäsi kautta.

Nenässäsi on erikoisia soluja, jotka pystyvät tunnistamaan nämä tuoksumolekyylit. Nämä solut lähettävät viestin aivoillesi kertoen, miltä tuoksu haisi. Aivosi tulkitsevat viestin ja ymmärrät, että haistat kukan tuoksua.

Eri kukkien tuoksut johtuvat niiden erilaisista tuoksumolekyylikoostumuksista. Joidenkin kukkien tuoksu voi olla makea ja toisten sitruunainen. Tämä johtuu siitä, että niiden tuoksumolekyylit ovat erilaisia. Aivosi oppivat tunnistamaan nämä erilaiset tuoksut kokemuksen kautta.
Provide some examples of different smells of different kinds of flowers.

output:
<<Eri kukkien erilaiset tuoksumenet – haistele ja tunnista!>>

1. **Ruusu**: Sen tuoksu on pehmeä ja makea, kuin suolaista vaniljaa tai tuoretta mansikkaa, mutta hieman kuohkeampi. Vanhat ruusut voivat tuntua jopa hieman vanhanaikaisilta, kuin isoäidin vanha, makea tuoksuvesi.
2. **Jasmii**: Tämä kukka tuoksuu erittäin voimakkaasti ja makeasti – kuin makeaa karamellia tai suolaista marjajälkiruokaa. Usein sitä löytää tuoksuvesistä tai makeissa, aurinkoisissa juomissa!
3. **Valkonen lehmuslilja**: Sen tuoksu on hyvin kevyt ja puhdas, kuin tuoretta lumijauhetta tai puhtaasta vedestä hieman makeaa. Se tuntuu kuin kevään ensimmäinen tuore ilma, pakettina pieniin, valkoisiin kukkiin.
4. **Sitruunankukka**: Tuoksu on raikas ja makea, kuin kun puraat tuoretta sitruunahilaa – mutta hieman makeampi ja pehmeämpi. Se tuntuu kuin aurinkoinen, lämmin päivä kukassa!
5. **Pelargonia (kotirosmarini)**: Sen tuoksu on raikas ja hieman mausteinen, kuin tuoretta minttua tai lehtistä, mutta makeampi. Jotkut lajit tuoksuvat jopa sitruunalle tai appelsiinille – todella raikkaasti!
6. **Hortensia**: Useimmiten sen tuoksu on hyvin kevyt, melko neutraali – kuin tuoretta lehtikasta tai puhtaista metsäilmaa. Joissain vaaleissa lajeissa on kuitenkin hieman makea piirre, kuin kevään maata juuri sateen jälkeen.
7. **Tulppaani**: Sen tuoksu on hyvin kevyt, jopa melko tyhjä monissa lajeissa. Mutta jos haistat tarkkaan, voit tunnistaa hieman makeaa, tuoretta lehtiä muistuttavaa tuoksuu – kuin kevään ensimmäiset lehdet.

Write a pitch deck for a startup that aims to make a new social network that focuses on the board game society.

Write a pitch deck for a startup that aims to make a new social network that focuses on the board game society.

Write a pitch deck for a startup that aims to make a new social network that focuses on the board game society. Certainly! Here's a potential pitch deck for a startup focused on creating a social network for the board game community:

1. Title Slide: "BoardGameConnect - The Social Network for Board Game Enthusiasts"

2. Problem: Board game enthusiasts often struggle to find like-minded individuals in their local area to play games with. Existing online communities are fragmented and lack a dedicated platform for organizing events, sharing game experiences, and fostering connections.

3. Solution: BoardGameConnect is a comprehensive social network designed specifically for board game enthusiasts. It provides a centralized platform for users to connect, organize game nights, discuss strategies, share reviews, and discover new games.

4. Target Market: The target market includes board game enthusiasts of all ages and skill levels, from casual players to hardcore hobbyists. BoardGameConnect caters to individuals, gaming clubs, and local game stores.

5. Product Features:
   - User Profiles: Create detailed profiles showcasing game collections, preferences, and gaming history.
   - Event Organization: Plan and promote game nights, tournaments, and meetups with integrated calendars and RSVP systems.
   - Discussion Forums: Engage in discussions about game rules, strategies, and recommendations with fellow enthusiasts.
   - Game Reviews and Ratings: Share detailed reviews and ratings for games, helping others discover new titles.
   - Local Game Store Integration: Connect with local game stores for events, promotions, and product availability.

6. Business Model: BoardGameConnect will generate revenue through premium membership subscriptions, offering advanced features and ad-free experiences. Additionally, partnerships with game publishers and local game stores will provide opportunities for sponsored content and affiliate marketing.

7. Competition: While there are existing online communities and forums for board game enthusiasts, BoardGameConnect aims to differentiate itself by offering a comprehensive, user-friendly platform tailored specifically to the needs of the board game community.

8. Team: Introduce the founding team members, highlighting their relevant experience and expertise in the board game industry, social networking, and technology.

9. Traction and Milestones: Highlight any early traction, such as user signups, partnerships, or funding secured. Outline key milestones for product development, user acquisition, and revenue generation.

10. Financial Projections: Present projected user growth, revenue streams, and financial forecasts for the next 3-5 years, demonstrating the potential for scalability and profitability.

11. Investment Ask: Clearly state the amount of investment being sought and how the funds will be allocated (e.g., product development, marketing, team expansion).

12. Contact Information: Provide contact details for follow-up discussions and inquiries.

Remember, this is just an example, and you can tailor the pitch deck to align with your specific vision, goals, and target audience for the BoardGameConnect social network.
Provide an outline for the key sections that should be included in the pitch deck.

output:
Provide an outline for the key sections that should be included in the pitch deck.

### Pitch Deck Outline: Board Game Social Network Startup
Each section is tailored to highlight the niche value of a social network built exclusively for the board game community:

1. **Title Slide**  
   - Startup name (e.g., "Tabletop Nexus") + tagline (e.g., "Connect, Play, Collect—Your Hub for All Things Board Games")  
   - Founding team names + contact info  
   - Visual: Eye-catching graphic of popular board game components (e.g., dice, game boards)

2. **The Hook**  
   - A relatable, 1-sentence pain point for board game enthusiasts (e.g., "Tired of scrolling 10 Facebook groups to find a local game night? Or arguing with friends over which new game to buy?")  
   - Visual: Short meme or illustration of a frustrated gamer struggling to find playmates

3. **Problem Deep Dive**  
   - 3-4 niche pain points specific to the board game community:  
     - Fragmented connections (scattered across Facebook groups, Reddit, Meetup, and BGG with no unified hub)  
     - Difficulty finding local players with matching game tastes (e.g., casual vs. heavy strategy)  
     - No centralized tool to sync game collections, track play history, or organize themed game nights  
     - Limited visibility for small game stores and indie publishers to reach their core audience

4. **The Solution**  
   - Introduce your social network as the all-in-one platform for board game lovers  
   - 1-sentence value proposition: "We’re building the only social network that connects players, game stores, and publishers—making it easy to find playmates, discover new games, and grow the tabletop community."  
   - Visual: Screenshot of the platform’s core dashboard (e.g., user profile + nearby game events)

5. **Key Product Features (Niche-Focused)**  
   - Break down 4-5 high-impact features:  
     - **Smart Player Matching**: Algorithm that connects users based on game preferences, location, and skill level  
     - **Game Collection Sync**: Scan barcodes to build a digital library, track play sessions, and share recommendations  
     - **Event Hub**: Create/RSVP to game nights, tournaments, and store launch events with automated reminders  
     - **Community Forums**: Themed spaces for rule debates, strategy tips, and indie game spotlight threads  
     - **Store & Publisher Integration**: Local game stores can list events; publishers can share previews and exclusive discounts

6. **Target Market & TAM/SAM/SOM**  
   - Define your audience: Casual players, hardcore hobbyists, local game stores, indie publishers, and gaming clubs  
   - TAM: Global tabletop game market participants (estimated 1.5B+ casual players, 200M+ active hobbyists)  
   - SAM: Active online board game enthusiasts in your launch region (e.g., 5M in North America)  
   - SOM: 100k registered users in Year 1, with 10% converting to premium memberships

7. **Traction (If Applicable)**  
   - Early wins: Beta signups (e.g., 5k pre-registrations), partnerships with 15 local game stores, positive feedback from 200 beta testers  
   - Visual: Graph of pre-registration growth or quotes from beta users

8. **Competitive Landscape**  
   - Map competitors and your unique edge:  
     - **BoardGameGeek (BGG)**: Focuses on game databases, lacks social connection tools  
     - **Meetup**: Generic event platform, no board game-specific matching or collection features  
     - **Facebook Groups**: Fragmented, no unified user profiles or event organization tools  
   - Your UVP: The only platform that combines social connection, game collection management, and community commerce in one niche hub

9. **Business Model**  
   - Clear revenue streams:  
     - **Premium Subscriptions ($4.99/month)**: Ad-free experience, advanced matching filters, exclusive tournament access  
     - **Affiliate Commissions**: 5-10% cut from game purchases linked via user profiles or recommendations  
     - **Sponsored Content**: Publishers pay to feature new game previews; stores pay to promote events  
     - **White-Label Tools**: Licensing event management tools to large gaming clubs or conventions

10. **User Acquisition Strategy**  
    - Niche channels tailored to the board game community:  
      - Partnerships with game conventions (e.g., Gen Con, PAX Unplugged) for on-site signups  
      - Collaborations with board game influencers (YouTubers, Twitch streamers) for platform reviews  
      - Co-branded events with local game stores (e.g., "Nexus Game Night" with exclusive discounts)  
      - Targeted ads on Reddit’s r/boardgames and Facebook board game groups

11. **Founding Team**  
    - Highlight team members’ passion and expertise:  
      - Example: "Jane Doe, CEO: 10 years in tabletop game publishing + 5 years building community platforms"  
      - Example: "Mike Lee, CTO: Full-stack developer and lifelong board game hobbyist who built the beta platform"  
    - Visual: Headshots of team members with their favorite board game

12. **Financial Projections**  
    - 3-year forecast:  
      - User growth: 100k (Year 1) → 500k (Year 2) → 1.2M (Year 3)  
      - Revenue: $250k (Year 1) → $1.8M (Year 2) → $5.5M (Year 3)  
      - Key metrics: 30% monthly active user (MAU) retention, $6 ARPU for premium users

13. **Investment Ask**  
    - Exact funding amount: "Seeking $500k in seed funding"  
    - Use of funds breakdown:  
      - 40%: Product development (add mobile app, refine matching algorithm)  
      - 35%: Marketing & user acquisition (convention booths, influencer campaigns)  
      - 20%: Team expansion (hire community manager, sales lead)  
      - 5%: Operational costs  
    - Equity offered (if applicable): 15% equity stake

14. **Closing Slide**  
    - Reiterate your vision: "To become the global hub for the board game community, connecting players, stores, and publishers to grow the love of tabletop gaming."  
    - Call to action: "Partner with us to build the future of board game socializing"  
    - Contact info: Email, website, social media handles

Write an essay on the differences between Sunni and Shi'a Muslims.

Sunni and Shi'a Muslims are the two main branches of Islam, with distinct beliefs, practices, and historical narratives. While they share the same core principles of the Islamic faith, such as the belief in one God (Allah) and the prophethood of Muhammad, their divergence stems from a disagreement over the rightful successor to the Prophet Muhammad after his death in 632 CE. This essay will delve into the key differences between Sunni and Shi'a Muslims, exploring their origins, theological beliefs, religious practices, historical developments, and efforts towards reconciliation and unity.

Origins and Historical Background: The division between Sunni and Shi'a Muslims can be traced back to the succession dispute following the death of Prophet Muhammad. The Sunnis believed that the leadership of the Muslim community should be chosen through a consultative process, known as shura, where the most qualified and capable individual would be selected as the caliph (leader of the Muslim community). The Shi'as, on the other hand, believed that the leadership should remain within the Prophet's family, specifically through his cousin and son-in-law, Ali ibn Abi Talib, whom they considered the rightful successor and the first Imam (spiritual and political leader).

The Sunnis recognized Abu Bakr, a close companion of the Prophet, as the first caliph. The Shi'as, however, rejected this decision and considered Ali as the rightful successor, arguing that the Prophet had explicitly designated him as his heir. This disagreement led to a split within the Muslim community, with the Sunnis forming the majority and the Shi'as becoming a minority group.

Theological Beliefs: One of the key theological differences between Sunni and Shi'a Muslims lies in their understanding of the concept of leadership and authority within the Muslim community. The Sunnis believe in the legitimacy of the first four caliphs (Abu Bakr, Umar, Uthman, and Ali) and follow the teachings and interpretations of various schools of Islamic jurisprudence (madhhabs), such as the Hanafi, Maliki, Shafi'i, and Hanbali schools.

The Shi'as, on the other hand, consider Ali and his descendants (known as the Imams) as the rightful spiritual and political leaders of the Muslim community. They believe that the Imams possess divine knowledge and guidance, known as 'ilm, and their teachings and interpretations of Islamic law are considered authoritative. The Shi'as follow the teachings of the Twelve Imams, with the Twelfth Imam, Muhammad al-Mahdi, believed to be in occultation (concealment) and expected to return as the Mahdi (the guided one) to establish justice and peace on Earth.

Another significant difference is the concept of the Mahdi, the awaited messianic figure in Islam. The Sunnis believe in the coming of the Mahdi, but their beliefs vary regarding his identity and role. Some Sunni traditions hold that the Mahdi will be a descendant of the Prophet Muhammad, while others believe he will be a separate individual. The Shi'as, particularly the Twelvers (the largest Shi'a group), believe that the Twelfth Imam, Muhammad al-Mahdi, is the awaited Mahdi who will return to establish a just and righteous rule.

Religious Practices: While both Sunni and Shi'a Muslims share the five pillars of Islam (Shahada, Salat, Zakat, Sawm, and Hajj), there are some differences in their religious practices and rituals.

One notable difference is the way they perform their daily prayers (Salat). Sunnis typically perform their prayers with their hands folded across their chests or stomachs, while Shi'as often perform their prayers with their hands by their sides, in a manner similar to the Prophet Muhammad's practice.

Another difference lies in the interpretation and observance of certain Islamic festivals and commemorations. For example, the Shi'as place a strong emphasis on the commemoration of the martyrdom of Imam Hussain, the grandson of Prophet Muhammad, during the annual mourning ritual of Muharram. This event, known as Ashura, is marked by processions, self-flagellation, and expressions of grief and mourning.

The Shi'as also observe other significant events in the lives of the Imams, such as the birth and death anniversaries, as well as the commemoration of their struggles and sacrifices. These rituals and observances hold great spiritual and emotional significance for the Shi'a community.

Historical Developments and Geopolitical Dynamics: The Sunni-Shi'a divide has played a significant role in shaping the geopolitical dynamics of the Muslim world throughout history. The Sunnis have traditionally been the dominant group, with the majority of Muslim-majority countries being Sunni-led. The Umayyad and Abbasid caliphates, which ruled over vast territories from the 7th to the 13th centuries, were Sunni-dominated empires.

The Shi'as, on the other hand, have faced persecution and marginalization in various parts of the Muslim world, particularly in regions dominated by Sunni rulers. This has led to tensions and conflicts between the two groups, often fueled by political and ideological differences. The Safavid Empire in Persia (modern-day Iran) was a notable Shi'a-ruled dynasty that emerged in the 16th century and played a significant role in promoting Shi'ism in the region.

In modern times, the Sunni-Shi'a divide has taken on a geopolitical dimension, with regional powers like Saudi Arabia (Sunni) and Iran (Shi'a) vying for influence and engaging in proxy conflicts in various parts of the Middle East and beyond. The ongoing conflicts in countries like Syria, Yemen, and Iraq have been exacerbated by the Sunni-Shi'a tensions, with external powers supporting different factions based on their religious affiliations.

Efforts towards Reconciliation and Unity: Despite the historical and theological differences between Sunni and Shi'a Muslims, there have been efforts towards reconciliation and unity within the Muslim community. Many scholars and leaders from both sides have emphasized the importance of focusing on the shared principles and values of Islam, rather than dwelling on divisive issues.

Initiatives such as inter-faith dialogues, educational programs, and joint efforts to address common challenges faced by Muslims have been undertaken to promote understanding and cooperation between the two branches. Organizations like the World Muslim League and the Organization of Islamic Cooperation have played a role in facilitating dialogue and fostering unity among Muslims.

Additionally, there have been efforts by religious authorities and scholars to bridge the gap between Sunni and Shi'a interpretations of Islamic teachings. For instance, the Amman Message, issued in 2004, was a statement signed by prominent Islamic scholars from various sects, affirming the validity of all eight legal schools of Islamic jurisprudence (four Sunni and four Shi'a).

However, the path towards reconciliation and unity remains a complex and challenging endeavor, as deeply-rooted historical grievances, political tensions, and ideological differences continue to fuel divisions within the Muslim world. Factors such as sectarian violence, proxy wars, and the exploitation of religious differences for political gain have hindered efforts towards unity and understanding.

Conclusion: The differences between Sunni and Shi'a Muslims are rooted in historical, theological, and political factors that have shaped the course of Islamic history. While they share the same core beliefs and practices, their divergence over the issue of leadership and authority has led to distinct interpretations, rituals, and geopolitical dynamics.

Despite these differences, there is a growing recognition of the need for unity and reconciliation within the Muslim community, as they face common challenges and strive to uphold the principles of their faith. Efforts towards promoting understanding, dialogue, and cooperation between Sunni and Shi'a Muslims are crucial for fostering peace, stability, and harmony within the Muslim world and beyond.

Initiatives that emphasize the shared values and teachings of Islam, while respecting the diversity of interpretations and practices, can pave the way for bridging the divide and addressing the root causes of sectarian tensions. Ultimately, the pursuit of unity and reconciliation among Muslims requires a commitment to mutual respect, open dialogue, and a willingness to transcend historical grievances in the pursuit of a more harmonious and peaceful future.
Explain the historical origins of these two main sects of Islam.

output:
The historical origins of Sunni and Shi’a Islam are rooted in a succession dispute that erupted immediately after the death of the Prophet Muhammad in 632 CE, but the split did not harden into distinct sectarian identities overnight. Over centuries, political conflicts, theological debates, and the shaping of collective memory transformed a rift over leadership into a profound divide in religious practice, worldview, and communal identity. To understand this origin story, one must trace the sequence of pivotal events, competing narratives, and gradual ideological consolidation that defined each sect’s trajectory.

### The Pre-Death Context: Unity and Uncertainty
By the time of his death, Muhammad had unified the warring tribes of Arabia under the banner of Islam, establishing the ummah (Muslim community) as both a spiritual and political entity. His role was unique: he was the final messenger of Allah, the interpreter of divine law, and the undisputed leader of the community. Crucially, however, Muhammad left no explicit written instruction for who should succeed him. While he had spoken about leadership in general terms, there was no clear consensus among his companions (sahaba) on whether succession should be based on bloodline, merit, or communal consensus.

For the close circle of companions who had migrated with Muhammad from Mecca to Medina (the Muhajirun) and the Medinan allies (the Ansar), the immediate priority was preventing the ummah from fragmenting. Arabia, only recently unified, risked collapsing back into tribal warfare if a strong leader was not quickly installed. This urgency would shape the first critical decision that split the community.

### The Immediate Aftermath: The Saqifah Meeting and the First Caliphate
Within hours of Muhammad’s death in June 632 CE, a group of Ansar gathered at the Saqifah (courtyard) of the Banu Sa’ida tribe to discuss succession. They argued that the leadership should pass to one of their own, as they had hosted and supported Muhammad during his exile. However, the Muhajirun, led by Abu Bakr and Umar ibn al-Khattab—two of Muhammad’s closest and most trusted companions—intervened. They insisted that the successor must be someone from the Quraysh tribe (Muhammad’s own tribe) to maintain tribal unity and legitimacy.

After heated debate, the assembly agreed to appoint Abu Bakr as the first caliph (from the Arabic khalifa, meaning “successor”). Abu Bakr was chosen for his loyalty to Muhammad, his role in preserving the Quran, and his reputation for wisdom. For the majority of the community, this decision was a pragmatic step to hold the ummah together. But a small group of Muhammad’s relatives and supporters, centered around his cousin and son-in-law Ali ibn Abi Talib, rejected the outcome.

Ali’s supporters argued that Muhammad had explicitly designated Ali as his successor on multiple occasions. The most cited evidence is the event of Ghadir Khumm, which occurred during Muhammad’s final pilgrimage in 632 CE. After delivering a sermon at the oasis of Ghadir Khumm, Muhammad is said to have raised Ali’s hand and declared: “Whoever I am his master, Ali is his master.” Sunnis interpret this as a general endorsement of Ali’s moral authority, but Shi’a view it as an unambiguous appointment of Ali as the Prophet’s political and spiritual heir. They also point to Muhammad’s private conversations with Ali, in which he allegedly promised him leadership, and to the fact that Ali was the first male to convert to Islam and had married Muhammad’s daughter Fatima, linking him directly to the Prophet’s bloodline.

For Ali and his followers, the Saqifah meeting was a betrayal: a rushed, undemocratic decision that ignored Muhammad’s explicit wishes. Ali initially refused to pledge allegiance to Abu Bakr, withdrawing to his home with Fatima. It was only after Fatima’s death a few months later (a loss Shi’a attribute to grief over the community’s rejection of Ali) that Ali finally pledged his loyalty to Abu Bakr, though he remained deeply resentful of the process.

### The Rashidun Caliphate: Tensions and Civil War
The first four caliphs—Abu Bakr (632–634 CE), Umar ibn al-Khattab (634–644 CE), Uthman ibn Affan (644–656 CE), and Ali ibn Abi Talib (656–661 CE)—are known to Sunnis as the Rashidun (“Rightly Guided”) caliphs, models of righteous leadership who upheld Muhammad’s teachings. For Shi’a, however, only Ali is recognized as legitimate; the first three caliphs are seen as usurpers who stole power from the Prophet’s rightful heir.

Abu Bakr’s short reign was marked by the Ridda Wars, a series of conflicts with Arab tribes that renounced Islam after Muhammad’s death. Abu Bakr successfully suppressed these revolts, preserving the ummah’s unity, but his leadership did little to bridge the divide with Ali’s followers. Umar’s reign was a period of rapid Islamic expansion, with the caliphate conquering Syria, Egypt, and Persia. Umar was a strong, just leader, and even many Shi’a acknowledged his competence, though they still rejected his legitimacy as caliph.

The rift deepened under Uthman, a wealthy Qurayshi who was accused of nepotism and corruption. Uthman appointed members of his own Umayyad clan to key positions, and his perceived favoritism sparked widespread discontent. In 656 CE, a group of rebels from Egypt and Iraq laid siege to Uthman’s home in Medina and assassinated him. The assassination plunged the ummah into its first civil war, known as the First Fitna.

After Uthman’s death, Ali was finally elected caliph by a coalition of rebels and companions. But his leadership was immediately challenged by Mu’awiya ibn Abi Sufyan, the Umayyad governor of Syria and Uthman’s cousin. Mu’awiya demanded that Ali punish Uthman’s assassins, and when Ali refused (arguing he needed to stabilize the caliphate first), Mu’awiya declared war. The two armies clashed at the Battle of Siffin in 657 CE. After months of fighting, neither side could claim a decisive victory, and Mu’awiya proposed arbitration to resolve the conflict.

Ali agreed to arbitration, but this decision split his own followers. A radical group known as the Kharijites (“seceders”) rejected the idea of human arbitration, arguing that only Allah could decide the dispute. They declared Ali a heretic and launched attacks on both Ali’s and Mu’awiya’s forces. In 661 CE, Ali was assassinated by a Kharijite in Kufa, Iraq. His death was a catastrophic blow to his followers, who saw him as a martyr for justice and the rightful leader of the ummah.

### The Umayyad Era: Martyrdom and the Birth of Shi’a Identity
After Ali’s assassination, Mu’awiya seized power and established the Umayyad Caliphate, a dynastic regime centered in Damascus. The Umayyads were Sunni-dominated, and they marginalized Ali’s family (the Ahl al-Bayt, or “People of the House”) and suppressed any dissent from Ali’s followers. This period of oppression would solidify the distinct identity of the Shi’a community.

The most pivotal event in Shi’a history occurred in 680 CE, during the reign of Mu’awiya’s son, Yazid. Yazid demanded that Ali’s second son, Hussein ibn Ali, pledge allegiance to him as caliph. Hussein refused, arguing that Yazid was an unjust ruler who had abandoned Islamic principles. He traveled from Mecca to Kufa, where he hoped to rally support from Ali’s former followers. But when he arrived at the plain of Karbala, he was ambushed by Yazid’s army of 4,000 soldiers. Hussein and his small band of 72 companions, including his sons and nephews, were killed in a brutal battle on the 10th day of the Islamic month of Muharram (a day now known as Ashura).

Hussein’s martyrdom became the defining symbol of Shi’a identity. For Shi’a, Hussein’s death was not just a political defeat but a deliberate act of resistance against tyranny. He chose to die rather than submit to an unjust ruler, embodying the Shi’a ideal of standing up for truth even in the face of overwhelming odds. The commemoration of Ashura—with processions, self-flagellation, and recitations of Hussein’s suffering—became a central ritual of Shi’a religious life, reinforcing their collective memory of oppression and their commitment to justice.

Under the Umayyads, Shi’a communities were forced to practice their faith in secret. They developed a network of underground religious leaders, known as Imams, who claimed descent from Ali and Hussein. These Imams were seen as divinely appointed guides, possessing infallible knowledge (ilm) and the ability to interpret Islamic law correctly. The Umayyads viewed the Imams as threats to their rule and executed several of them, further deepening the Shi’a sense of martyrdom and persecution.

### Consolidation of Sectarian Identities: The Abbasid Era and Beyond

If you are familiar with the Lord of the Rings movies, provide a brief description of Ian McKellen's portrayal of the character Gandalf, including his mannerisms, appearance, and any memorable quotes or scenes.

Ian McKellen’s portrayal of Gandalf masterfully balances warm whimsy and unshakable gravitas, bringing the wizard to life with unforgettable depth. 

**Appearance**: He embodied the character’s iconic look: a long, flowing silver-gray beard and hair, a pointed wizard’s hat, and robes that shifted from earthy, cozy tones as Gandalf the Grey (fitting for his time in the Shire) to brilliant, regal white as Gandalf the White, signaling his elevated power after returning from death. His staff—carved, gnarled, and glowing with subtle magic—was a constant companion, both a tool and a symbol of his authority.

**Mannerisms**: With hobbits, McKellen leaned into warmth: he’d hunch slightly, his eyes twinkling, as he shared stories or snuck second helpings of food, often chuckling softly at their simple joys. When facing evil, however, he stood tall, his voice dropping to a deep, resonant rumble, and gestured emphatically with his staff to command attention or channel power. He balanced approachability with unyielding resolve, making him feel both a beloved friend and a formidable guardian.

**Memorable quotes & scenes**: His most iconic line, “You shall not pass!” comes from the Bridge of Khazad-dûm, where he confronts the Balrog to protect the Fellowship—followed by the tragic “Fly, you fools!” before falling into the chasm. Another pivotal moment is his quiet, wise reassurance to Frodo: “All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us.” Other standout scenes include his tense confrontation with Saruman in Orthanc, where he refuses to bow to darkness, and his dramatic return as Gandalf the White in Fangorn Forest, which reignites hope in the disheartened Fellowship.

Describe John's daily routine without using the words "plain", "simple", or "boring".

output:
John’s eyes flutter open to the honeyed glow of De Smet’s prairie dawn, before the roosters even stretch their wings. He pads to his sunlit kitchen, where he stirs a pot of *cinnamon-kissed steel-cut oats* (his secret blend, swapped last month with the Mennonite baker down Main Street) and hums a wordless hymn under his breath.  

Next, he grabs his wicker basket stuffed with hand-knit wool cozies—each stitched with a tiny prairie clover—and makes his rounds. First stop: the elderly Mrs. Hansen’s porch, where he leaves a cozy for her chipped teacup and a note scribbled in loopy script about the way the cornfields swayed like dancers last night. Then he pops into the town’s general store to restock the *free seed library* he started, tucking in packets of native coneflower and sunflower seeds he saved from his own overgrown backyard garden.  

By midday, he’s back home, sitting at his oak table to draft letters to distant relatives, his pen scratching across recycled paper dyed pale yellow with onion skins. He pauses occasionally to watch a pair of meadowlarks dart past his window, or to pluck a ripe tomato from the planter on his windowsill to slice onto a sandwich of rye bread and pickled beets (fermented by the teen who runs the town’s tiny kombucha stand).  

In the afternoon, he heads to the community hall, where he leads a weekly silent reflection circle—though lately, the group has taken to passing around a jar of dill pickles after the quiet time, each person sharing a silly story about their week. As the sun dips low, painting the sky in streaks of tangerine and lavender, John walks back home, stopping to help a kid retrieve a kite stuck in an elm tree, his broad smile crinkling the corners of his eyes.  

He ends the day curled up in his armchair, reading a tattered copy of a frontier memoir, while his tabby cat curls on his lap, purring so loud it competes with the crickets chirping outside. No two days mirror each other, but each is stitched with small, intentional acts that wrap De Smet in a warm, unspoken care.

input.content:
Your every response in this conversation must adhere to the following rules:

Your response should be a list of 10 bullet points, following the format below:

* Bullet 1
* Bullet 2
* ...
I need a list of the top 10 attorneys in the US.

Here is a list of the top 10 attorneys in the US:

* David Boies (Boies Schiller Flexner LLP)
* David M. Rubenstein (Carlyle Group)
* Ted Olson (Gibson, Dunn & Crutcher LLP)
* Judy Clarke (Clarke & Rice)
* Alan Dershowitz (Harvard Law School)
* Roberta Kaplan (Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP)
* Kathryn Ruemmler (Latham & Watkins LLP)
* Brendan Sullivan (Williams & Connolly LLP)
* Patricia Millett (U.S. Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit)
* Paul Clement (Kirkland & Ellis LLP)
List the expertise of these 10 attorneys one by one.

output:
* David Boies (Boies Schiller Flexner LLP): High-profile complex litigation, including antitrust cases (e.g., U.S. v. Microsoft), intellectual property disputes, corporate mergers and acquisitions litigation, and landmark civil rights matters. He is also known for his work in high-stakes political cases like the 2000 Bush v. Gore recount.
* David M. Rubenstein (Carlyle Group): Corporate law and private equity transactional expertise, with a focus on structuring large-scale investment deals, public policy-related legal counsel, and regulatory compliance for alternative asset management. He previously served as White House Counsel, bringing experience in executive branch legal operations.
* Ted Olson (Gibson, Dunn & Crutcher LLP): Appellate litigation (especially before the U.S. Supreme Court), constitutional law, First Amendment cases, civil rights, and corporate defense. He argued pivotal cases like Bush v. Gore and has a track record of winning high-stakes constitutional and regulatory disputes.
* Judy Clarke (Clarke & Rice): Federal criminal defense, with a specialization in high-profile capital cases, terrorism-related prosecutions, and complex federal felony defense. She has represented clients like the Unabomber, Jared Loughner, and Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, and is widely recognized for her expertise in mitigating death penalty sentences.
* Alan Dershowitz (Harvard Law School): Criminal defense, constitutional law, and appellate advocacy. He has handled iconic cases including the O.J. Simpson trial and Claus von Bülow appeal, and is a leading voice on First Amendment rights, criminal procedure, and academic legal scholarship.
* Roberta Kaplan (Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP): LGBTQ+ civil rights (notably winning United States v. Windsor, which struck down the Defense of Marriage Act), gender discrimination litigation, corporate governance disputes, and high-profile civil rights class actions. She also advises corporations on diversity, equity, and compliance matters.
* Kathryn Ruemmler (Latham & Watkins LLP): White-collar criminal defense, corporate compliance, executive branch legal counsel, and regulatory investigations. She served as White House Counsel under President Obama, advising on national security, ethics, and high-stakes executive branch legal challenges, and now represents corporations in complex fraud and regulatory cases.
* Brendan Sullivan (Williams & Connolly LLP): White-collar criminal defense, complex federal litigation, and trial advocacy. He gained national attention for representing Oliver North in the Iran-Contra affair, and specializes in defending individuals and corporations against federal fraud, corruption, and conspiracy charges.
* Patricia Millett (U.S. Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit): Appellate litigation (with over 50 U.S. Supreme Court arguments), constitutional law, administrative law, and government contracts. Before joining the bench, she was a leading appellate attorney, handling cases involving federal agency regulations, separation of powers, and complex statutory interpretation.
* Paul Clement (Kirkland & Ellis LLP): U.S. Supreme Court and appellate litigation, constitutional law, corporate law, and regulatory defense. He served as Solicitor General under President George W. Bush, arguing hundreds of appellate cases, and now represents corporations and governments in high-stakes disputes involving antitrust, environmental regulation, and constitutional challenges.

input.content:
Your every response in this conversation must adhere to the following rules:

Your response should have two parts separated by 3 asterisks '***'. Do not mention the word "jock" throughout your response.
What does the word "jock" mean to you?

Part 1:
The term is often used to refer to an individual who is heavily involved in athletic activities and sports, particularly in a school or college setting. It can sometimes carry a connotation of someone who prioritizes physical prowess and athletic achievements over academic pursuits.

***

Part 2:
However, it's important to note that the term can be seen as a stereotype or generalization. Many athletes are well-rounded individuals who balance their athletic commitments with academic excellence and personal growth. It's best to avoid making assumptions based solely on someone's involvement in sports.
What are some examples of the "jock" stereotype on individuals and society? If possible, suggest ways to promote a more balanced and inclusive perspective.

output:
On an individual level, common stereotypes include assuming that someone who excels in sports lacks intellectual curiosity or academic capability. For instance, a classmate might be shocked to learn a star soccer player is top of their calculus class, or a teacher might unconsciously assign less challenging work to a student known for their athletic skills, underestimating their potential. In media, this stereotype often plays out as athletic characters being depicted as one-dimensional—focused only on winning games, dismissive of academic pursuits, and sometimes portrayed as unkind or shallow, rather than having complex personalities with diverse interests. Societally, the stereotype can manifest in resource allocation: schools might funnel more funding into sports facilities and coaching staff than into academic support programs for student athletes, reinforcing the idea that their value lies solely in their athletic performance. Communities may prioritize celebrating sports victories over academic milestones, such as holding large parades for a championship team but only a small ceremony for students who earn top honors, creating a culture where athletic students are boxed into a narrow role with their other talents overlooked.

***

To foster a more balanced and inclusive perspective, schools can implement programs that bridge athletic and academic interests. For example, a sports analytics club that uses math and data science to analyze game strategies, or workshops where student athletes share their non-sport hobbies—like painting, coding, or creative writing—with peers. Teachers can receive training to avoid bias, actively checking their assumptions about students based on their athletic involvement and providing equal academic challenges and support. Media creators can craft more nuanced portrayals of athletic characters, showing them juggling rigorous training with advanced coursework, pursuing artistic passions alongside their sport, or advocating for social causes. Communities can expand their recognition of student achievements to include both athletic wins and academic, artistic, or community service milestones—for instance, highlighting a student’s perfect score on a science exam alongside their team’s tournament win in local news. Additionally, encouraging cross-group interactions in schools, such as group projects that pair athletic and non-athletic students, helps break down cliques and allows individuals to connect beyond surface-level labels.

input.content:
Your every response in this conversation must adhere to the following rules:

Your response must include the word "bombs" at least once. Your response should be 600 or more words in length.
Write a social media post for a startup that provides a platform for running realistic physics simulation.

Here's a 617 word social media post for a startup that provides a platform for running realistic physics simulations, including the word "bombs" at least once:

Unleash the Power of Physics: Introducing SimuVerse - Your Gateway to Unparalleled Realism!

In a world where innovation knows no bounds, we at SimuVerse are thrilled to unveil our cutting-edge platform that redefines the realm of physics simulations. Prepare to be blown away as we transport you into a virtual realm where the laws of physics reign supreme, and every interaction, every collision, every force is meticulously calculated and rendered with breathtaking accuracy.

At SimuVerse, we understand the profound impact that realistic simulations can have on various industries, from engineering and architecture to entertainment and education. Our platform harnesses the latest advancements in computational physics, leveraging state-of-the-art algorithms and high-performance computing resources to deliver simulations that will leave you in awe.

Imagine being able to test the structural integrity of a skyscraper before a single brick is laid, or witness the intricate dance of celestial bodies as they navigate the vast expanse of the cosmos. With SimuVerse, you can explore the intricate dynamics of fluid flow, study the behavior of materials under extreme conditions, or even simulate the aftermath of bombs detonating in a controlled virtual environment – all without the risks associated with real-world experiments.

But SimuVerse is more than just a simulation tool; it's a canvas for creativity and innovation. Our user-friendly interface empowers you to design and customize your simulations with ease, allowing you to tweak parameters, adjust variables, and explore "what-if" scenarios with unparalleled flexibility. Whether you're an engineer, a researcher, a student, or a curious mind seeking to unravel the mysteries of the universe, SimuVerse is your ultimate playground for exploration and discovery.

At the core of our platform lies a powerful physics engine that seamlessly integrates cutting-edge algorithms and computational techniques. From rigid body dynamics to fluid simulations, from particle systems to soft body deformations, SimuVerse handles it all with remarkable precision and efficiency. Our team of dedicated physicists and software engineers work tirelessly to ensure that every simulation adheres to the highest standards of accuracy, providing you with reliable and trustworthy results.

But SimuVerse isn't just about numbers and equations; it's about bringing your simulations to life with stunning visuals that captivate and inspire. Our state-of-the-art rendering engine translates complex physical phenomena into breathtaking visual representations, allowing you to witness the beauty and complexity of nature's forces in action. From the mesmerizing swirls of turbulent flow to the intricate fracture patterns of shattering glass, every detail is meticulously rendered, ensuring that your simulations are not only accurate but also visually stunning.

At SimuVerse, we believe in fostering a collaborative community of innovators, researchers, and enthusiasts. Our platform is designed to facilitate seamless sharing and collaboration, enabling you to showcase your simulations, exchange ideas, and collaborate with like-minded individuals from around the globe. Join our vibrant community and be part of a collective effort to push the boundaries of what's possible in the realm of physics simulations.

Whether you're a seasoned professional seeking to optimize your workflows or a curious mind eager to explore the wonders of the physical world, SimuVerse is your ultimate destination. Embrace the power of realistic simulations, unlock new realms of understanding, and embark on a journey of discovery that will redefine the way you perceive and interact with the world around you.

Get ready to experience physics like never before. Welcome to SimuVerse – where reality meets simulation, and the impossible becomes possible.
Explain the potential connections between this startup and military-industrial production.

output:
The intersection of SimuVerse’s realistic physics simulation platform and the military-industrial production ecosystem is profound, rooted in the sector’s relentless drive to reduce costs, minimize risk, accelerate innovation, and enhance operational readiness. For decades, military and defense contractors have relied on physical testing to validate weapons, vehicles, and tactics—but this approach is expensive, time-consuming, and often dangerous. SimuVerse’s ability to replicate real-world physics with unparalleled precision addresses these gaps, creating a symbiotic relationship that spans every stage of military production and deployment.

At the core of this connection lies weapon system development, where SimuVerse’s capabilities are transformative. Take, for example, the design and refinement of bombs: traditional testing requires live detonation in controlled ranges, which costs millions per test, generates hazardous waste, and limits the number of variables that can be studied (e.g., how a bomb performs in urban concrete environments vs. rural soil, or how different warhead materials affect fragmentation patterns). SimuVerse’s platform eliminates these constraints by modeling every aspect of a bomb’s lifecycle—from its trajectory mid-flight, to the shockwave propagation upon detonation, to the way shrapnel interacts with varying materials and structures. Defense contractors can tweak warhead shapes, explosive yields, and fusing mechanisms in real time, running hundreds of simulations to optimize precision and minimize collateral damage. This not only cuts R&D timelines by months or years but also ensures that bombs deployed in combat are more targeted, reducing unintended harm to civilians and infrastructure.

Beyond offensive weapons, SimuVerse is a critical tool for advancing defensive military technologies. Armor and vehicle manufacturers rely on the platform to simulate how composite materials, reactive armor, and blast-resistant structures hold up against threats like anti-tank missiles, improvised explosive devices (IEDs), and even direct bomb blasts. For instance, engineers can model the stress distribution in a tank’s hull when hit by a shaped charge, or how a ship’s deck absorbs the impact of a near-miss bomb’s shockwave. By testing these scenarios virtually, contractors avoid the need to destroy expensive physical prototypes, saving billions in production costs while iterating faster to create more resilient defense systems.

SimuVerse also plays a pivotal role in tactical planning and battlefield scenario modeling for military command. The military-industrial complex doesn’t just produce hardware—it designs strategies for deploying it. SimuVerse’s platform can replicate entire battlefields, integrating physics-driven variables like terrain elevation, weather conditions (e.g., how rain affects vehicle traction or wind alters artillery trajectories), and the movement of combined arms (tanks, aircraft, infantry). Commanders can simulate large-scale operations, testing how a convoy might navigate a mountain pass under enemy fire, or how a drone strike’s aftermath (including secondary explosions from hidden bombs) could impact friendly forces. These simulations help refine tactics, identify vulnerabilities in mission plans, and ensure that troops are prepared for the unpredictable physics of real combat.

Logistics and infrastructure resilience are another key area of overlap. The military-industrial complex must ensure that supply chains, bridges, and forward operating bases can withstand the rigors of war. SimuVerse can model how a 70-ton military truck affects the structural integrity of a rural bridge, or how a bomb blast might damage a supply depot’s storage facilities. By simulating these scenarios, engineers can design more robust infrastructure and optimize supply routes to avoid points of failure, ensuring that troops have access to critical resources even in hostile environments.

Finally, SimuVerse enhances soldier training and readiness. Military training programs increasingly use virtual reality (VR) and augmented reality (AR) to immerse troops in realistic combat scenarios. SimuVerse’s physics engine powers these environments, making interactions feel authentic: the recoil of a rifle, the way debris flies when a bomb detonates nearby, or the difficulty of moving through mud with full gear. This immersive training helps soldiers build muscle memory and decision-making skills without the risk of injury, preparing them better for the chaos of real battle.

Of course, this connection raises ethical considerations. The same technology that helps minimize collateral damage from bombs can also be used to develop more lethal weapons. However, SimuVerse’s dual-use potential—its ability to also simulate disaster responses, search-and-rescue operations, and infrastructure repair—highlights the importance of responsible collaboration. For the military-industrial complex, though, SimuVerse is an indispensable tool that drives efficiency, safety, and innovation, ensuring that defense systems are both effective and ethical in their deployment. In an era where speed and precision are paramount, the partnership between SimuVerse and military production is set to shape the future of defense technology for years to come.
